subject: Mental Health
title: Family and Systems Therapy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Family and Systems Therapy.

hook.text: What if the problem isn't in the person but in the family system around them?

buildup.text: In the 1950s, therapists began treating families as interconnected systems, not individuals.

twist.text: A child's symptoms often reflect the family's unspoken conflicts and dysfunction.

climax.text: Changing the system often heals the individual more effectively than individual therapy alone.

punchline.text: Heal the system and the person follows.

quiz.question: What does family therapy treat?
options: The family system and its dynamics, not just the individual
